p: It was a very pleasant trip, Sigurd driving us so smoothly - and treating us to dinner on the way - When we arrived the place looked as it always does, so sweet and bright. Maxie is not at all well and needs a rest as her finger has been paining her considerably. We are waiting to make sure it really is what she believes it to be, namely

a bruise caused by prolonged hurt from using the scissors over several weeks' time - and then the scickle after which it really began to hurt. She believes it is less painful now. If it should turn out to be a felon we will of course have it properly taken care of - Out we really hope and think it is not. The children as well as Max wanted to hear all the details about your darling babye etc.
I think you would have bene thrilled
at the lovely picture we gave of our blessed grandson! He surely is a swell baby and we want to see him soon again.
I have sent the scales up to you - It is hard to read the face but you can weigh him and make a mark on the dial each time, which will show you that he is, or is not gaining, can't you?
You Ollie might even make new numbers on it. The scales are good
ones and you may Keep them.
We are so happy to have all those good peaches, you gave us too many!
Nanny is sending a wee brush for our Neihardt Boy - if you Ollie have gotten one it is O.K. to have two of them!
I love you three and want to hear from you soon.
